questionnaire.name: 5. theBIKEnet Travel Habits - How you move every day

sections.title: Welcome to the theBIKEnet Travel Habits Questionnaire
sections.description:
ðŸš² theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities â€” combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This fifth questionnaire looks at how you move every day: the means of transport you use, the purpose and frequency of your trips, and how cycling or micromobility fit into your daily routine. Your answers will help us identify mobility patterns and multimodal behaviours across the city.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Frequency and Purpose
sections.description: Main transport modes, frequency of trips, and reasons for moving around the city.

questions.text: Which means of transport do you use most often for your regular trips?
For what purposes do you mainly travel by bicycle or e-scooter?
How often do you ride a bicycle or an e-scooter?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1â€“2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: How often do you use public transport for your daily commute or other trips?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1â€“2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: Do you use micromobility (bike, e-bike, or e-scooter) in combination with public transport for your trips (for example, to reach or leave a bus, metro, or train station)?

options.text: Yes, almost every time I use public transport

questions.text: How easy do you find it to integrate micromobility (e.g., cycling, e-scooter) into your daily routine?

sections.title: Cycling and Micromobility Experience
sections.description: Your overall experience with bicycles or e-scooters, both in Rome and elsewhere.

questions.text: How many years of cycling experience do you have in Rome?

options.text: I have never cycled or used e-scooters in Rome

questions.text: How many years of cycling experience do you have in Italy (including Rome)?

options.text: I have never cycled or used e-scooters in Italy

questions.text: How many months or years of cycling or micromobility experience do you have abroad (outside Italy)?

sections.title: Micromobility Use
sections.description: How you use your bicycle or e-scooter: when, where, and for what purpose.

questions.text: Which type of bicycle or e-scooter do you use most frequently?
What is the typical distance of your trips by bicycle or e-scooter?
At what time(s) of day do you mostly ride a bicycle or an e-scooter?
Do you usually ride alone or with other people?
Do you regularly carry passengers (e.g., children) or cargo (bags, groceries, work equipment)?
Do you regularly accompany or assist someone during your trips (for example, children, elderly, or people with disabilities)?

options.text: Yes, I accompany children or minors
Yes, I accompany people who need assistance (elderly, disabled, etc.)
Yes, I accompany colleagues or friends
